articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Rangnang Disabled Soldiers' Essential Plastic Goods Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Rangnang Disabled Soldiers' Essential Plastic Goods Factory
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, gave field guidance to the Rangnang Disabled Soldiers' Essential Plastic Goods Factory.
					 Shaking hands with its officials, he kindly asked them about the health of all the disabled soldiers and their troubles. He said that he came to the factory to encourage the disabled soldiers reliably serving at new posts for improving the people's standard of living with patriotism they displayed during military service.
					
					 After being briefed on the factory before a map showing its panoramic view, he went round a room for the education in the revolutionary history and a room dedicated to the history of the factory.
					
					 He noted that the factory, which was founded as a small unit producing simple ironware with some equipment in October 1970 when the Fifth Congress of the WPK was held, is stepping up production in the van of the whole country. This would have been unthinkable without the meticulous guidance and solicitude of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, he added.
					
					 He kept his eyes for a long time to a photo showing the benevolent image of Kim Jong Il seeing goods at the factory in October 2011, the last period of his life.
					
					 Going round various places of the factory, he learned in detail about its production.
					
					 Seeing goods one by one, he said that there are varieties of goods and they were made to be useful, adding that the disabled soldiers are excellent in working style.
					
					 The Rangnang Disabled Soldiers' Essential Plastic Goods Factory is a model factory in equipment management, he noted, instructing officials to widely introduce the factory to the whole country and make other factories to learn from it.
					
					 He went round newly-built welfare service facilities and sci-tech knowledge dissemination room.
					
					 He said that welfare service facilities consisting of public bath, barber's, exercise and treatment recovery room were designed and built well.
					
					 Noting he feels they were built with determination, he said with pleasure that the employees of the factory would be very glad at them.
					
					 He said that there is nothing to spare for the disabled soldiers, treasure of the country, adding officials should take good care of their life so that they work well in good health. He stressed that all the Party organizations should regard it as their duty and mission to take meticulous care of the disabled soldiers' life so that they do not feel slight troubles and inconvenience.
					
					 Going round the factory, he could know again that the disabled soldiers are invariably taking the road of struggle for the country and the people as they did during solders' days, in hearty response to the intention of the Party that the disabled soldiers should keep the flower of revolution in bloom, he said. He had a photo session with them.
					
					 He was accompanied by Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and premier of the Cabinet, Ri Ju O, vice-premier of the Cabinet, An Jong Su, department director of the C.C., WPK, and Jo Yong Won, vice department director of the C.C., WPK.

articles.title: UN Special Rapporteur's Visit to DPRK
articles.content:
UN Special Rapporteur's Visit to DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Catalina Devandas Aguilar, UN special rapporteur on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities, and her party visited the Democratic People's Republic of Korea from May 2 to 9.
					 The purpose of her visit to the DPRK was to learn about the general situation of the persons with disabilities and discuss the issues concerning the implementation of the convention related to rights of the disabled to which the DPRK recently acceded and to explore the way for possible offer of technical cooperation necessary for abiding by the convention.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to categorically reject the anti-DPRK "resolutions" cooked up by the hostile forces in the UN human rights arena on the basis of the "false testimonies" made by "defectors from the north" and fabrications with a sinister aim to bring down the socialist system of the DPRK, and never to recognize anyone as "special rapporteur" related to human rights situation in the DPRK if he or she appears, pursuant to the "resolutions."
					
					 But the DPRK, out of its stand to attach importance to true dialogue and cooperation in the international human rights field and remain true to the international human rights conventions it acceded to, invited the special rapporteur to visit it and did its best to make the visit successful.
					
					 During the visit, the special rapporteur and her party paid courtesy calls on Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk and Ambassador of the Foreign Ministry Ri Hung Sik of the DPRK, and met officials concerning the issue of the disabled including those of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly (Legislative Department), the Foreign Ministry, the Education Commission, the Ministry of Public Health, the Central Committee of the Korean Federation for the Protection of the Disabled, the Deaf Association of Korea and the Blind Association of Korea to thrash out the issues for implementing the convention on rights of the disabled.
					
					 During the calls and talks, the DPRK informed the special rapporteur in detail of the facts that all its people are fully enjoying genuine rights under respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's politics of prioritizing, respecting and loving the people and that the disabled are leading a worthy life without suffering any discrimination, thanks to the advantageous policies and measures of the state including the universal 12-year compulsory education and the universal free medical care system. 
					
					 The special rapporteur thanked the DPRK government for its cooperation with her and offering convenience to her for her successful visit, and evinced her will to proactively cooperate with the DPRK side to implement the convention on rights of the disabled, thoroughly preserving the principle of fairness and objectivity in her future activities.
					
					 She said that exchange of views with officials of various organs of the DPRK including the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly (Legislative Department) during her visit was positive and she was pleased to obtain valuable detailed information to be consulted in outlining the report on her visit to be submitted to the 37th session of the UN Human Rights Council due in March 2018.
					
					 During their sojourn in the DPRK, the special rapporteur and her party toured the Okryu Children's Hospital, the library for the disabled at the Sci-Tech Complex, the Korean Rehabilitation Centre for Children with Disability and the Pyongyang Primary School for Orphans in the city of Pyongyang and the Pongchon Blind School in South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 They also watched a performance of the art group of the disabled and met them at the building of the Korean Art Association of the Disabled and enjoyed the 2017 Spring Table-Tennis Tournament for the Disabled and Amateurs at the gymnasium of Kim Il Sung University.

articles.title: 12th Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics
articles.content:
12th Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The 12th Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics took place at the Central Youth Hall here on Wednesday.
					 Among those present were Ma Won Chun, director of the Designing Department of the State Affairs Commission; Tong Jong Ho, minister of Construction and Building-Materials Industry; Kwon Song Ho, minister of State Construction Control; Kim Kyong Jun, minister of Land and Environment Protection; Kang Yong Su, minister of Urban Management; Jo Sok Ho, chairman of the Capital City Construction Commission; and officials of construction and science and education fields and the participants in the 17th May 21 Architectural Festival.
					
					 Speakers at the symposium mentioned the feats of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un who is ushering in the great era of prosperity of construction, and the achievements and experience gained in creating architecture on the people-first principle. They also referred to the theoretical and practical problems arising in embodying the Workers' Party of Korea's idea and theory on Juche-based architecture and its construction policy.

articles.title: Int'l Symposium of Kim Il Sung University Held
articles.content:
Int'l Symposium of Kim Il Sung University Held
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- An international symposium of Kim Il Sung University took place on May 9-10 under the theme "Ecological environment protection and development of medical science and agriculture". 
					 Presented to it were dozens of scientific and technological papers.
					
					 Its opening ceremony was held at Kim Il Sung University on Tuesday.
					
					 Attending it were officials, teachers and researchers of Kim Il Sung University and professors of universities of different countries.
					
					 Ri Kuk Chol, first vice-president of Kim Il Sung University, in his opening address said that the symposium would mark an occasion in strengthening the friendship and ties between Kim Il Sung University and science research institutes of universities in different countries and opening a new phase for scientific exchanges.
					
					 The symposium was divided into panels of ecological environment protection, life science, medical science and agriculture. 
					
					 It closed on Wednesday.

articles.title: National Symposium on Medical Science
articles.content:
National Symposium on Medical Science
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- A national symposium on medical science took place at the Sci-Tech Complex on Tuesday and Wednesday.
					 More than 460 scientific papers were presented to the symposium divided into panels of basis medicine, pharmacy, surgery, therapeutics, sanitary science and prevention of epidemics and Koryo medicine.
					
					 Drawing interest of the participants were papers dealing with successes and experience gained in medical science and technology, including the issues for introducing advanced diagnosing and curing methods, effectively curing diseases and putting the production of efficient medicines on a modern and scientific basis.

articles.title: Sci-Tech Presentation of Veterinary and Anti-Epidemic Field Held
articles.content:
Sci-Tech Presentation of Veterinary and Anti-Epidemic Field Held 
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- A sci-tech presentation of veterinary and anti-epidemic field took place at the Grand People's Study House here on May 9-10 with the 70th founding anniversary of the Epizootic Prevention Center as an occasion.
					 Attending it, sponsored by the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea, were scientists, technicians and officials in the veterinary and anti-epidemic field from across the country.
					
					 Introduced there were ore than 240 papers on the achievements and experience gained in the process of developing the ways to put the veterinary and anti-epidemic work, diagnosis of animal diseases, production of foot-and-mouth disease vaccine, etc., on a high sci-tech basis.

articles.title: Romanian Embassy Officials Visit Taedonggang Beer Factory
articles.content:
Romanian Embassy Officials Visit Taedonggang Beer Factory
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Gheorghe Cioaca, charge d'affaires ad interim, and staff members of the Romanian embassy here visited the Taedonggang Beer Factory on Wednesday on the 140th anniversary of independence of Romania.
					 They went round different production processes of the factory.

articles.title: National Records Renewed in Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games
articles.content:
National Records Renewed in Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- National records were renewed in shooting, swimming and weightlifting events of the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games held in celebration of the Day of the Sun, birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (April 15).
					 The Defence Sports Team of the Korean People's Army set new records in women's team 10-meter running target mixed event and women's team 10-meter air rifle event and women swimmers of the April 25 Sports Team in 100-meter butterfly, 1,500-meter freestyle and 4Ã—100 meters mixed relay events.
					
					 Meanwhile, a new record was also established in men's 69 kg weightlifting.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Russian Party Leader
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Un from Russian Party Leader
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a congratulatory message from V. V. Zhirinovsky, chairman of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, on April 25.
					 The message said:
					
					 Please accept my heartfelt congratulations to you on the 85th founding anniversary of the heroic Korean People's Army.
					
					 The army of the DPRK is the pride of the Korean people as it reliably guarantees the integrity and firmness of the territorial land, seas and air of the country.
					
					 The KPA faithful to the leadership of the DPRK which has modern arms and equipment is fully ready to cope with any provocations of the warmongers and their vassal forces.
					
					 All the service personnel from soldiers to generals of the KPA, which was founded in the period of the liberation war fought against the Japanese occupiers, have glorious tradition of unrivalled braveness and tenacity to beat back threats of outside forces violating freedom and independence of the DPRK.
					
					 Respected Comrade Marshal, I hope that you would achieve successes in the work to maintain the highest combat capability of the armed forces of the DPRK protecting the labor gains of all the Korean people on the founding anniversary of the KPA.
					
					 I wish peaceful sky above the land of Korea.

articles.title: DPRK People Vow Revenge against Terrorist Maniacs
articles.content:
DPRK People Vow Revenge against Terrorist Maniacs
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons and civilians of the DPRK are hardening their will to terminate not only the organizers, conspirators and followers of the recent terrorist plot to hurt the supreme leadership of the DPRK but also the plot-breeding organizations, dens of all evils, of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet group of traitors.
					 Ho Song Guk, an officer of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, told KCNA:
					
					 It is intolerable that the homicidal maniacs hatched a plot to commit a state-sponsored terrorism targeting the supreme leadership of the DPRK by use of bio-chemical substance.
					
					 We will mercilessly punish with Songun (military-first) arms those bloodthirsty felons who are desperately keen on eclipsing the eternal sun of the DPRK, the mental mainstay that all the DPRK people absolutely trust and repose in.
					
					 The world will clearly see how merciless the Korean-style anti-terrorist striking actions will be and what miserable end the hostile forces will meet.
					
					 Rim Suk Hui, a worker of the Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory, called for exterminating those criminals to the last one at any cost.
					
					 Kim Chol Jin, a student of Kim Chaek University of Technology, said that a stern punishment was already sentenced to the heinous terrorists.
					
					 The enemies can hardly imagine where on earth the DPRK will start its righteous anti-terrorist striking actions and how the actions would be carried out, he said, and adding:
					
					 The striking actions will continue till we mercilessly wipe out the terrorist maniacs to the last one and completely destroy their strongholds.

articles.title: Korean Revolution Museum Draw Many Visitors
articles.content:
Korean Revolution Museum Draw Many Visitors
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The Korean Revolution Museum is now drawing an endless stream of visitors.
					 More than 100,000 people have visited the museum for 40-odd days since it was opened after being remodeled as one of national treasure which comprehensively shows the revolutionary history of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu.
					
					 It was visited by the military attaches corps and members of foreign embassies here, foreigners from Nepal, Bangladesh, Italy, Egypt and other countries and overseas Koreans.

articles.title: Papers Brand U.S. Plan for Civilians' Evacuation Drill as Prelude to War against DPRK
articles.content:
Papers Brand U.S. Plan for Civilians' Evacuation Drill as Prelude to War against DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Days ago the U.S. noisily advertised the plan of a drill for evacuation of American civilians including families of U.S. troops staying in south Korea to overseas to be scheduled in June. In the past the U.S. conducted in secrecy such drill twice a year in spring and autumn on the plea of "non-combatant evacuation operation", pursuant to the "plan for evacuation of civilians". However, this time the U.S. announced the period of the drill far earlier than usual.
					 This is nothing but a prelude of a war for invading the DPRK and an open declaration of the U.S. to ignite a war at any moment, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a commentary.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The U.S. announced the shady plan for evacuation drill nearly two months earlier to frighten the DPRK. This is a very foolish behavior.
					
					 In the past Korean War, the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces could return to their homes though they were badly beaten. But now if a war breaks out, even survivors cannot seek a shelter anywhere. The U.S. would be well advised to urgently take measures to save the lives of hundreds of millions of Americans in the mainland rather than being concerned about security of those in south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. is going to flee from south Korea after igniting a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula. This is the sinister intention of the U.S. vociferating about "solid alliance" with south Korea. That is why the south Korean puppet authorities should not prick their own eyes with their own fingers any longer.
					
					 Minju Joson in an article says that the only way for the U.S. to escape complete destruction is to withdraw not only its civilians but also all the aggressor forces in south Korea if it is fearful of the deadly strike of the DPRK and is concerned about the lives of its citizens.

articles.title: S. Korea: Opening to Public of Documents on Park Geun Hye's Crimes Urged
articles.content:
S. Korea: Opening to Public of Documents on Park Geun Hye's Crimes Urged
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The Bar Association for Democratic Society of south Korea Monday urged the Archives to open to public the documents related to Park Geun Hye's whereabouts for seven hours when the Ferry Sewol disaster occurred, according to News One of south Korea.
					 It blamed Prime Minister Hwang Kyo An for fixing the documents related to Park's whereabouts at the time of the ferry Sewol disaster as document requiring 30 year-long protection.
					
					 Holding that such measure should be retracted as it lacks a legal ground, the Association called for opening to public the documents made or received at the "presidential" secretary, guards and security offices during the disaster.
					
					 It also urged the Archives to declassify the documents related to the agreement on the sexual slavery for the Japanese army and bearing of THAAD operation costs.

articles.title: S. Koreans Demand Legal Step against THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Koreans Demand Legal Step against THAAD Deployment
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of inhabitants living in Songju County and Kimchon City of North Kyongsang Province of south Korea submitted an appeal to the "Constitutional Court" on Monday demanding a halt to the regime's introduction of THAAD equipment, according to the south Korean Newsis.
					 They criticized the regime for pushing ahead with deployment of THAAD despite strong public backlash.
					
					 They called for retracting the deployment project without fail, terming it an unconstitutional abuse of power infringing upon the principal right of the inhabitants.

articles.title: Day of Sun Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
Day of Sun Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- Events took place in many countries to celebrate the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included meetings, seminars, joint gatherings, lecture meetings, round-table talks and book and photo exhibitions in Iran, Kuwait, Norway, Denmark, Switzerland, Finland, Austria, Iceland, Italy, Spain, Ecuador, Peru, Uganda, Libya and Congo.
					
					 Displayed at their venues were photos dealing with the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 There were also works of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu and books and photos introducing the reality of the DPRK.
					
					 The international secretary of the Communist Party of Norway said that President Kim Il Sung would be always alive in the hearts of the Koreans and the world people as he is the father of socialist Korea and made tremendous contributions to the accomplishment of the human cause of independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association and the general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society stressed that the President's feats for the times and history would remain long with the era of independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Ecuadorian Cultural Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea said that a radical turn was made in hewing out the destiny of mankind, socialism centered on the popular masses was built and the progressive mankind could dynamically advance along the road of independence as there is the April holiday when the sun of Juche rose.
					
					 The chairman of the Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People said that all the achievements of the Korean people would have been unthinkable without the wise leadership of the President and the 20th century was a century of the President both in name and reality.
					
					 The chairman of the Congo-Korea Friendship Committee of the Congolese Association for Friendship among Peoples praised the career of the President dedicated to the prosperity of the country and happiness of the people.

articles.title: Works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Printed in Russia
articles.content:
Works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Printed in Russia
 Pyongyang, May 10 (KCNA) -- The Knizhnii Mir Publishing House of Russia brought out in pamphlet works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on April 13.
					 They are Kim Il Sung's work "3. Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully" from "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee" and Kim Jong Il's works "On Establishing the Juche Outlook on the Revolution", "Answers to Questions Raised by the ITAR-TASS of Russia" and "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy".
					
					 "3. Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully" from "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee", published on October 10, Juche 69 (1980), refers to the struggle conducted by the Workers' Party of Korea to achieve the national reunification in the period under review and the tasks for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 It also clarifies a new reunification proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK) on the basis of the three principles of national reunification and the 10-point policy to be enforced by the DFRK.
					
					 "On Establishing the Juche Outlook on the Revolution", made public on October 10, 1987, underlines the importance to grasp the outlook on the revolution as faith through practical activities and clarifies the essence and formation of the Juche outlook on the revolution and the tasks for establishing it.
					
					 "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy", published on July 26, 1996, deals with the idea that the Juche philosophy is an original one worked out and systematized by its own principles and it is a revolutionary and popular philosophy truly serving the purpose of the popular masses' struggle for independence.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for studying and introducing the Juche philosophy as intended by the party and thoroughly applying it to the revolutionary practice.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita fabrica de ex militares minusvalidos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita fabrica de ex militares minusvalidos
Pyongyang, 10 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Fabrica de Articulos Plasticos de Uso Diario de Ex Militares Minusvalidos de Rangnang.
					Apretando la mano con cada uno de los funcionarios de la planta, el pregunto carinosamente como estan los empleados y que les faltaba. Agrego que ha venido para estimular a los ex militares minusvalidos quienes trabajan ahora en el nuevo puesto para el mejoramiento de los niveles de la vida poblacional haciendo uso del patriotismo manifestado en los dias de servicio militar.
					
					Luego de escuchar explicaciones ante el plano de la fabrica, recorrio la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria y la otra de presentacion del historial.
					
					Esta planta fue fundada en octubre de 1970, ano de celebracion del V Congreso del PTC, como pequena unidad productora de simples articulos de hierro de uso diario que tenia unos equipos nada mas, recordo. 
					
					Pero, ahora marcha al frente de todo el pais y esta realidad es inimaginable sin la esmerada guia y grandes benevolencias del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, anadio.
					
					Miro largo rato la foto de la imagen generosa del Dirigente presenciando los productos de la fabrica donde el estuvo en octubre de 2011, ultimo periodo de su vida.
					
					En su recorrido por varios puntos de la fabrica, Kim Jong Un se cercioro del estado de produccion.
					
					Luego de examinar uno tras otro los articulos hechos en la fabrica, reconocio el modo de trabajo loable de los ex militares minusvalidos diciendo que hay muchas variedades y ellas son muy utiles. 
					
					Calificando la fabrica de entidad ejemplar en el mantenimiento de equipos, instruyo presentarla ampliamente y aprenderla en todo el pais.
					
					Estuvo en la facilidad de servicio publico y la sala de divulgacion de ciencias y tecnicas, acondicionadas nuevamente.
					
					Han disenado y construido bien la facilidad de servicio publico compuesta por el bano publico, la barbaria, la sala de recuperacion con fisioterapia, senalo y se mostro satisfecho diciendo que ella les gustaria mucho a los empleados.
					
					No hay nada que escatimar para los ex militares minusvalidos, tesoros del pais, y se debe atender esmeradamente la vida de ellos para que cumplan bien sus tareas en buen estado de salud, dijo. 
					
					Encomendo a todas las organizaciones partidistas que consideren como obligacion y mision atender bien la vida de los ex militares minusvalidos para que ellos no tengan ni la minima dificultad o incomodidad.
					
					Se fotografio con los empleados expresando que el recorrido por esta fabrica le hizo conocer una vez mas que los ex militares minusvalidos siguen luchando por el bien de la patria y el pueblo como en los dias de servicio militar, en pleno acato al proposito del Partido de que ellos deben continuar el camino de la revolucion.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta visita Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y primer ministro de la RPDC, el vicepremier Ri Ju O, el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, An Jong Su, y el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Catalina Devandas Aguilar visita a la RPDC
articles.content:
Catalina Devandas Aguilar visita a la RPDC
Pyongyang, 10 de mayo (ACNC) -- Catalina Devandas Aguilar, relatora especial encargada de los derechos de los discapacitados, perteneciente al Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU, y su comitiva visitaron del dia 2 al 9 a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					El objetivo de su visita estuvo en averiguar la situacion general de los discapacitados, discutir los problemas relacionados con la ejecucion de la convencion de los derechos de ellos, firmada recientemente por la RPDC, y buscar la posibilidad de ofrecer la cooperacion tecnica para el respecto.
					
					Es invariable nuestra posicion de rechazar totalmente las "resoluciones de derechos humanos" anti-RPDC fabricadas por las fuerzas hostiles en los escenarios de DDHH de la ONU basandose en las "declaraciones falsas" de los "fugitivos norcoreanos" y datos inventados y de no reconocer jamas al "relator especial" encargado de la situacion de DDHH en la RPDC, nombrado segun esos documentos.
					
					Pero, partiendo de la voluntad de apreciar el dialogo y cooperacion verdaderos en el sector internacional de DDHH y de ejecutar con sinceridad los acuerdos internacionales de DDHH, de que es signataria la RPDC, incluso la convencion de los derechos de discapacitados, la RPDC invito a la relatora especial encargada de los derechos de los discapacitados, perteneciente al Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU, e hizo todo lo posible para su exitosa visita.
					
					Durante su estancia, ella y su comitiva realizaron las visitas de cortesia al ministro de Salud Publica Kang Ha Guk y al embajador del MINREX Ri Hung Sik y se reunieron con los funcionarios de los sectores vinculados con los discapacitados como el Departamento de Legislacion del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, el Comite de Educacion, el Ministerio de Salud Publica, el Comite Central de la Federacion de Proteccion a Discapacitados de Corea, la Asociacion de Sordomudos de Corea y la Asociacion de Ciegos de Corea, etc. para discutir profundamente los asuntos relativos a la ejecucion de la convencion mencionada.
					
					En esas ocasiones, la RPDC informo en detalles que gracias a la politica del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un de apreciar, respetar y amar al pueblo, todos los coreanos ejercen genuinos derechos humanos y los discapacitados tambien llevan una vida digna, sin someterse a ningun tipo de discriminacion, en virtud de las politicas y medidas ventajosas del Estado, inclusive el sistema de educacion obligatoria general de 12 anos y el de asistencia medica gratuita general.
					
					La visitante expreso agradecimiento por la cooperacion y confort que ha brindado el gobierno de la RPDC para la realizacion de su visita. Manifesto la voluntad de materializar cabalmente el principio de imparcialidad y objetividad en las futuras actividades y cooperar activamente con la parte coreana en la implementacion de la convencion referida.
					
					Dijo que fue positivo el intercambio de opiniones con los funcionarios de varios organos coreanos, inclusive el Departamento de Legislacion del Presidium de la APS de la RPDC.
					
					Se mostro complacida de que haya podido obtener datos valiosos y concretos que tomara de referencia en la elaboracion del informe sobre la visita a presentar a la 37a reunion del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU que sesionara en marzo del ano proximo.
					
					Durante su permanencia, la relatora especial y sus acompanantes visitaron el Hospital de Pediatria Okryu, la sala de lectura para los discapacitados en el Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas, el Centro de Recuperacion de Ninos Discapacitados de Corea, la Escuela Primaria de Internado de Pyongyang en esta capital y la Escuela de Ciegos de Pongchon en la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					
					Ademas, presenciaron en la Asociacion Artistica de Discapacitados de Corea la funcion ofrecida por los miembros del grupo artistico de discapacitados y se reunieron con ellos.
					
					Tambien, vieron el torneo primaveral de tenis de mesa de discapacitados y aficionados de 2017, efectuado en el gimnasio de la Universidad Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Diplomaticos coreanos participan en banquete por el "Dia de Europa"
articles.content:
Diplomaticos coreanos participan en banquete por el "Dia de Europa"
Pyongyang, 10 de mayo (ACNC) -- Con motivo del "Dia de Europa", el embajador aleman Thomas Schaefer y el polaco Krzysztof Ciebien, acreditados en Corea, ofrecieron el dia 9 en conjunto un banquete.
					A la recepcion fueron invitados los funcionarios de la cancilleria coreana, incluso el titular de la Direccion no.2 de Europa, Kim Son Gyong, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises y los representantes de organizaciones internacionales en Corea.
					
					Los representantes diplomaticos expresaron el deseo de que se relaje la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y se prepare la resolucion pacifica mediante el dialogo y negociaciones.
					
					El banquete transcurrio en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Efectuado XII Simposio sobre la Estetica Arquitectonica
articles.content:
Efectuado XII Simposio sobre la Estetica Arquitectonica
Pyongyang, 10 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 10 en la Casa Central de la Juventud el XII Simposio sobre la Estetica Arquitectonica.
					En la ocasion participaron el director de diseno del Comite de Estado, Ma Won Chun, el ministro de Construccion e Industria de Materiales de Construccion, Tong Jong Ho, el ministro de Control Estatal de las Construcciones, Kwon Song Ho, el ministro de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental, Kim Kyong Jun, el ministro de Urbanismo, Kang Yong Su, el presidente del Comite de Construccion Capitalina, Jo Sok Ho, los funcionarios de los sectores de construccion como diseno, ejecucion de obra y supervision y de las instituciones cientificas y docentes, asi como los participantes en el XVII Festival Arquitectonico 21 de Mayo.
					
					Los seminaristas argumentaron las hazanas del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, quien abre la era dorada de la construccion, y los exitos y experiencias alcanzados en la creacion de arquitectura centrada en las masas populares. 
					
					Hablaron sobre los problemas teoricos y practicos que se presentan en cumplir cabalmente la idea, teoria y politica del partido en materia de la autoctona arquitectura y construccion.

articles.title: Concluido el simposio internacional de Universidad Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Concluido el simposio internacional de Universidad Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, 10 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar los dias 9 y 10 el simposio internacional de la Universidad Kim Il Sung bajo el tema de "Proteccion del ambiente ecologico y desarrollo de la medicina y agricultura".
					  Se presentaron en la ocasion decenas de disertaciones cientifico-tecnicas.
					
					  La ceremonia inaugural se efectuo el dia 9 en ese plantel docente con la participacion de los funcionarios, profesores e investigadores del mismo y los profesores universitarios de varios paises.
					
					En su discurso de apertura, el primer vicerrector de la Universidad, Ri Kuk Chol, dijo que el presente simposio sera un motivo para estrechar la amistad y lazos entre los organos de investigacion cientifica de la Universidad Kim Il Sung y las otras de varios paises, y abrir un nuevo horizonte de intercambio academico.
					
					El foro tuvo los talleres de proteccion del ecosistema, ciencia de vida, medicina y agricultura y quedo clausurado el dia 10.
